intro: Scrophularia minima, commonly known as lesser scarlet pimpernel, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, often with toothed edges, and are arranged oppositely along the stems. Scrophularia minima thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges.
